title: [K-12] Information Literacy Enhancement Project Using Web-Based Inquiry Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency and academic research material search experience
context.additional_context: Learners comprehensively develop information literacy skills—collection, analysis, critical evaluation, and ethical use—by applying the ISIS-21 strategy to solve real-world social issues. A flexible learning environment using personal devices is provided, with the final output being an inquiry report.

learning_goals: Learners can identify and evaluate at least three credible information sources on specific social topics using the web-based ISIS-21 strategy
Learners can critically analyze the credibility of collected information to discern falsehoods and biases with over 80% accuracy
Learners can apply information literacy skills to produce final project reports through team-based inquiry in a PBL environment

resources: Digital Collaboration Tools (Notion, Google Workspace, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
